data.job_description:
If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?

What's in it for you?

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities. Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.

You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.

As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.

What We're Looking For

Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation.

Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.

Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models.

Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard.

Run human centred design sessions with end-users.

Communicating and influencing stakeholders.

Coaching non-data experts how to use data.

Skills And Attributes For Success

Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data.

Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it.

Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority.

Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems.

Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data.

Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage.

Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku).

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $90,000 including 11% superannuation.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you

Ideal Candidate
• Fluent in English.
• Excellent research skills.
• Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
• Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Australia.
• Analytical mindset.

Job Requirements
• Must be living in Australia for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
• Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
• Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
• Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
• Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
• All work must be of an independent nature.

Technical requirements to perform the work

Access to a laptop or computer which uses:
- A logon account unique to you
- Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed
- Only one member per household may apply
NB. All products should be provided at your own expense.

Benefits

· Work up to 20 hours per week.
· Earn a competitive rate of pay.
· Develop your research skills.
· Avoid the long commute.
· Work from the comfort of your home office.
· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours

About the role:

The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.

The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.

Duties:
• Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation.
• Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners.
• Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development.
• Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques.
• Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.

Required experience/skills:
• Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality.
• Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
• Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders
• Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.

Desirable experience skills:
• Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design.
• Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data.
• Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields.
• Experience operating in a policy environment.

The Office of the Student Identifiers Registrar (OSIR) administers the Unique Student Identifier (USI), a Council of Australian Government initiative delivered by the Australian Government. It links the training records of over 14 million Australians and international students collected from over 4000 Registered Training Organisations. We have recently expanded USI to Higher Education students.

Over 4 million individuals use the USI Registry system each year to create, retrieve or update their USI information and view and download their USI Transcript.

The OSIR is a dynamic service delivery environment that comprises of a call centre, stakeholder outreach, compliance, and the development of supporting USI systems and website. We are committed to providing easy and informative access to our services and support programs and work directly with our clients and stakeholders to ensure expectations are met.

The Senior Data Analyst is part of the Policy, Data and Compliance Team. The Team is responsible for:
• OSIR policies.
• Privacy and data breach management.
• Compliance and enforcement.
• Data analysis and reporting to inform business priorities.
• Business assurance activities to identify risk and opportunities for improvement.

The key duties of the position include
Responsibilities of the Senior Data Analyst may include:
• Coordinating the business intelligence and reporting functions of the team.
• Extracting and integrating data from a range of sources to develop and maintain a range of reports and analytics products for both internal and external stakeholders.
• Undertaking transaction analysis for data security and compliance activities.
• Supervision of the aps5 data and reporting officer.
• Leading the strategic data plan for OSIR.
• Providing a high level of support for the student identifiers registrar, senior management, team members and OSIR staff.

Could the skills you build here unlock doors anywhere?

At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.

We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.

The opportunity

Due to continued success and growth, an exciting opportunity exists for a Data Analytics Senior Consultant or Manager to join our highly regarded People Advisory Services team.

Our team works as a well-integrated national team, where you’ll have the opportunity to work with Australian-based and multinational clients across the country, therefore offering you the ability to work with large corporates, and a diverse range of industries. In this role, you will have access to training, coaching and support that’s available to help grow your career even further!

This role is open to various locations - Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide, and Perth.

What’s in it for you?

As our Data Analytics Senior Consultant or Manager - your responsibilities will include:
• Modelling of various Industrial Instrument (including Enterprise Bargaining Agreements, Industry Awards etc.) for wage compliance projects;
• Modelling of superannuation and Pay-As-You-Go Withholding data modelling projects (including the preparation of superannuation guarantee charge statements and voluntary disclosure letters);
• Liaise directly with clients and other regulatory authorities (e.g. Australian Taxation Office, Fair Work Australia etc.) in the delivery of data projects;
• Work with different parts of the business in driving growth in the global mobility data analytics practice;
• Preparing & presenting training seminars to both clients and team members.

What We’re Looking For

Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go.
• Degree in Data Analytics/Commerce, or similar;
• Between 1-5 years’ experience in a data analytics discipline (focused towards wage compliance and employment taxes remediation);
• Experience with Alteryx at the intermediate or advanced level;
• Experience with data visualisation software such as Power BI and Tableau;
• Experience with SQL, Python, and other database/coding languages [preferred];
• Ability to lead and mentor junior members of our team;
• Commitment to excellence in client service, with the ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team.

DSTG is currently experimenting and building capability with Large Language Models (LLMs) and Computer Vision (CV) techniques at large scale for the purpose of assessing their applicability to the Defence context.

Existing initial demonstrators have shown great promise and DSTG is now in need of four machine learning engineers to further develop, accelerate and mature these capabilities.

Successful applicants will be working with leading-edge hardware and ML technologies, demonstrating the art of the possible and working toward bringing ML based technology into the Defence domain in support of Defence's mission and capabilities.

The Machine Learning Engineers will be required to work as part of an integrated team spanning ICT professionals and engineers, DSTG Researchers, Defence Operators and Analysts. They will work as part of a team designing and developing machine learning systems, implementing appropriate ML algorithms, conducting experiments and demonstrating outcomes and ML based opportunities to the Defence stakeholders. They will be working with DSTG data sets to create models, perform statistical analysis, to train and retrain systems to optimise performance with a goal to build efficient self-learning applications and contribute to Defence's advancements in artificial intelligence.

Essential Criteria
• Experience in software development & machine learning.
• Experience in the use of machine learning methods on multi-GPU platforms.
• Extensive Linux knowledge.
• Ability to communicate effectively and tailor presentation style and messaging to be relevant to a range of audience level of knowledge, skills and experience.
• Sound interpersonal skills including the ability to work as a productive member of a team and communicate effectively with colleagues and clients across multiple organisational levels.
• Effective written and verbal communication skills.
• Respond strongly and positively to challenging work and deadlines.

Desirable Criteria
• Hightly Desirable: Experience in the use and development of machine learning methods at scale within standalone or multi-GPU and multi-node configurations.
• Hightly Desirable: Experience in MLOps and ModelOps software and associated engineering practices.
• Hightly Desirable: Experience with best practice development methodologies and practices such as Agile, DevOps, and Configuration-As-Code.
• Hightly Desirable: Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture.
• Hightly Desirable: Knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms as applicable to the ML context.
• Hightly Desirable: Ability to write code in Python, Java or R.
• Hightly Desirable: Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn).
• Hightly Desirable: Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Previous experience within the Defence environment.
• Familiarity with Defence IT security policies and concepts.
• Security Clearances for Nominated Personnel.

How To Apply

Please submit your updated CV to demonstrate your suitability to the role as well as providing a 2-3 page response to the Essential & Desirable Criteria.

About Us

It’s an exciting time for Discovery Parks. Since our inception in 2004 we have experienced extensive growth. We currently own and operate over 65 Holiday and workforce Parks throughout Australia and employ over 1100 people. Discovery Parks has recently acquired Australia’s largest network of parks – Top Parks.

At the heart of Discovery Parks are happy people: happy customers and happy staff. We are building a passionate, adaptable, high performance team that works together to help our customers discover what matters.

The Role

Discovery Holiday Parks is embracing the new normal and is undertaking an historic transformation to build the Park and Digital Experience of the future. Accordingly, significant investment is being made into technology and business processes to develop custom attribution and predictive models focusing on customer behavior across our entire accommodation network. This is an incredibly exciting opportunity to use the latest Microsoft tools and technologies to drive actionable insights to add value to the business.

The Data Scientist will apply the latest data science techniques within the context of our customers and business, to improve customer experience and drive returns.

This role will require you to;

· Lead the team that provides customer insights to the business across the customer journey

· Apply your broad skill-set across data and analytics to understand business problems, create insights and provide practical solutions

· Provide business solutions and optimisation through various statistical and quantitative methods

· Provide statistical models to support predictive analytics and deliver non-technical presentations to all levels of the business as well as technical documentation to the wider team

· Identify and develop the capability to track detailed competitor data and leverage existing internal data to inform smart customer lead decision making

· Conduct investigative analytics reports to inform the customer journey experience

· Liaise closely with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders, you will have a collaborative personal style and be commercial as well as customer focused

Your Experience

A Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Finance, Economics along with working knowledge of data science, analytics, or data engineering is essential to the success of this role.

To be successful in this role you will have proficiency and experience in statistical modelling and machine learning techniques combined with a high level of proficiency with programming languages used in data science. You will have excellent verbal and written communication skills which will be utilised when working across cross function teams and external stakeholders.

Data Scientist - Physical Modelling will collaborate across many stakeholders to analyze and refine datasets that will shape subsurface models
About Fleet Space Technologies
Fleet is a space-enabled exploration technology company on a mission to dramatically accelerate the discovery of critical minerals needed to decarbonize our global economy. Electric vehicles and other clean energy technologies are vital elements of the world’s efforts to combat climate change, and these will demand many times more critical minerals than today, with an incremental value of over USD $13 trillion. At the same time, finding new mineral deposits is becoming more challenging as we increasingly exhaust the supply of shallow deposits and are forced to explore deeper underground. Traditional exploration methods are poorly suited to address this challenge, so a new approach is needed.

Our approach is to combine space technology, proprietary seismic sensors, cutting edge Ambient Noise Tomography, and machine learning to provide the world’s first scalable 3D exploration dataset with near-real-time insights to guide active exploration programs far more efficiently to new deposits. This is Fleet’s flagship product, ExoSphere - a space-enabled solution for mineral exploration in real-time, in 3D, and under cover with very low environmental impact. Since launching ExoSphere in March 2022, Fleet has signed contracts with over 30 clients including Rio Tinto, Barrick Gold and Core Lithium and completed over 120 Ambient Noise Tomography surveys, more than any other company in the world.

As part of Fleet’s founding vision to connect the Earth, Moon, and Mars, we also apply our technology to innovative solutions for defense and space exploration, including an upcoming mission to the Moon. Headquartered in Adelaide, South Australia, Fleet has rapidly grown to over 100 employees including a growing team in the USA, Canada, and beyond. We have raised over AUD $85M in venture funding, backed by premier investors including Blackbird, Grok, and In-Q-Tel.

Core Values
The Core Values at Fleet Space Technologies guide us to our North Star of ambitious, collaborative success - AD ASTRA (“To the Stars!”)
• Add Value: Obsessively add value for our customers
• Drive Excellence: Benchmark against the best
• Agile Action: Take Action. Independent, fast, frugal action
• Seek Truth: Be curious. Explore
• Take Responsibility: Make decisions and own them
• Radical Ideas: We are unique. We do things differently
• Always Deliver: We always find a way to get it done on time

The Team
The Science Team at Fleet Space Technologies is composed of team-oriented technical experts who are driving innovation in exploration technology for use on the Earth and beyond it. As the core developers of ExoSphere, we are at the forefront of several fields all at once – seismology, exploration geology, and machine learning to name a few. We are creative, combining space technology and in-house sensors with computational geophysics and machine learning to unlock geological insight from the subsurface in a way that nobody else has tried before. And we are bold, applying this technology not just on the Earth, but on the surface of other planetary bodies in our solar system. It's not rocket science, but it's close! One must not only bring proven technical expertise, but also be open minded, agile, and adaptable to solve challenges that could very well change our world (and others beyond). We value diversity of perspective, journey, industry experience, skillset, working style, communication preference, and identity; the fact that we come from over 28 nationalities only reinforces our commitment to Inclusion & Diversity.

As a business, we are ambitious, innovative, and collaborative and we put our customers first in everything that we do. We love celebrating our successes, and we have had a lot to celebrate to date including Series C Funding and selection of our technology to be among the first Australian hardware to be deployed on the Moon. We are a diverse group of professionals who have come together for one purpose - to build spacecraft for explorers of new worlds with a mission to connect Earth, Moon and Mars. Come help shape the future through this fantastic opportunity!

The Role
Fleet Space Technologies is seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join the Science team and guide the Physical Modelling activities across cross-functional teams. We seek a person with a broad skill set of modeling physical systems that involve large data sets. A strong mathematical and physics knowledge is applied to a wide range of applications from identifying anomalies in mining data sets to fleet management of space assets, the incumbent will provide data modeling support and technical advice to external clients and other internal stakeholders at Fleet (including Product, Software, Satellites, Sales, etc.). This challenging and inspiring role is ideal for candidates who have extensive data science + physics + modeling experience and are passionate about utilizing 3D exploration data to drive new discoveries in a team environment within an agile, high-growth, cutting edge technology organization. As Machine Learning techniques are used to unlock information within the data, expertise utilizing advanced technologies and progressive means will ensure success.

Reporting to the Director of Planetary Geophysics, the Data Scientist - Physical Modelling will collaborate across many stakeholders to analyze and refine datasets that will shape subsurface models for clients, embedding them into their exploration programs and delivering exceptional results. They will also provide valuable input to internal teams for product development. The incumbent should expect to engage with a plethora of yet to be defined challenges that will drive revenue for the company, inspire/challenge them technically, and help change the world (while taking Fleet interplanetary)!

They will partner with multiple teams including :
• The Account Management team, consisting of experienced geologists who work with clients to plan and execute surveys and co-develop interpretations of resulting subsurface models
• The Geophysics team, to assist in ongoing agile development of Fleet’s data processing codebase
• The Software team, responsible for building and maintaining the cloud platform and data ingestion infrastructure required to support ExoSphere surveys
• The broader Data Science team, to assist in the training and use of predictive machine learning models for geological outputs of interest for clients
• The Product team - to collaboratively work on requirements and make sure we're building the right thing for our customers
The preferred location of this role is Australia (remote or based in Adelaide, South Australia) or the West Coast of North America (USA or Canada) and can be based from Chile or the European Union; based on prior experience and ability to team remotely.
• **Applicants must have full working rights from one of the following jurisdictions: Australia, Canada, United States of America, Chile, or the European Union.

Main Responsibilities
This role will be responsible for but not limited to:
• Build models and techniques to extract information from multiphysics data sets
• Work with SaaS software team to translate models and algorithms into operational software
• Compiling and reporting on large geophysical data sets
• Evaluating the performance of analysis techniques
• Represent Fleet and present results at relevant conferences
• Process and interpret data using industry standard geophysical interpretation software
• Adapting data collection procedures
• Actively keeps up to date with Data Science and Machine Learning advancements
• Maintain relevant documentations
• Interest and willingness to take Fleet Space Technologies to the depths & summits of the Earth, to the Moon & Mars, and beyond!

Key Skills and Required Experience
• Masters of Science in Mathematics, Computer Science, Geology/Geophysics or Physics - with foundational Bachelor's (Tertiary) Degree is required; PhD is a plus but not required
• Experience in physical modeling of large systems and extracting unique information from data set
• Experience in developing algorithms to allow users to manipulate data a near real time environment
• Professional presentation and communication skills
• Strong report writing skills
• Good analytical and interpretation skills
• Programming experience: Python, Matlab, and similar
• Familiarity with SaaS products and development a plus
• Experience in GeoPhysics a plus
• Global citizen with the willingness to travel for client/company visits, conferences and to other locations as needed
• Applicants must have full working rights from one of the following jurisdictions: Australia, Canada, United States of America, Chile, or the European Union.

BHP and OZ Minerals

OZ Minerals is now proudly part of BHP, with the acquisition strengthening BHP’s portfolio in copper and nickel, helping to meet the worlds increasing demand for the critical minerals needed for electric vehicles, wind turbines and solar panels, to supporting the energy transition to a cleaner and more sustainable future.

In combining our two organisations we will be able to provide more options for growth, bringing new talent and innovation together to unlock these resources in a sustainable way, and deliver value to our shareholders and the communities in which we operate.

Our strategy has and will always be to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. As we work through this transitional period of bringing both organisations safely together, we know that some processes will take longer than others and for now we will be continuing to temporarily recruit roles for our West Musgrave project within the OZ Minerals recruiting platform.

The Opportunity

We are currently looking for a Business Analyst to help us set up our newest, open pit mining project!

West Musgrave will be one of the world’s largest, lowest cost, lowest emissions copper-nickel projects.

You could be part of the team that helps to deliver this exciting mine, set within the Australian landscape. And we welcome anyone who’s seeking to make a real difference.

Our West Musgrave nickel-copper project is located on Ngaanyatjarra country, in the Musgrave Province of Central Western Australia, and includes the Nebo and Babel nickel-copper deposits and the Succoth copper deposit.

West Musgrave, which has a 26-year mine life, will be an owner-operator mining operation and in addition to being powered by ~80 per cent renewable energy, the Project scope includes a pathway to net zero Scope 1 emissions by 2038.

The Project will feature an Autonomous Haulage System and remote operations from day one and our workforce will be a flexible, technology enabled team supported by remote operations to improve safety outcomes and maximise opportunities for flexible working and diverse participation.

About The Role

Location: Perth or Adelaide preferred, with travel to West Musgrave site as required

Roster: 5:2 Monday to Friday

Reporting to: Lead Business Analyst

Contract Type: 12 month fixed-term contract

Pay & Benefits: We offer competitive Australian mining industry pay and benefits. We can talk about specifics later.

The Details

Reporting to the Lead Business Analyst, you will support the delivery of the Digital Strategy by collaborating with internal stakeholders to define business problems via in-depth investigation and gathering of technical and non-technical information.

In this role, you will lead product ownership, identify improvement opportunities and be responsible for the timely delivery of digital systems. You will work with a lean and dynamic team of internal and external resources within an agile framework.

You will be accountable to Program Leads associated with the allocated projects.

Key Responsibilities

This role will focus on ensuring the West Musgrave Project is safely delivered on time and on budget. Activities include but are not limited to:
• Successfully deliver a portfolio of projects within a domain of technology and business operation, including:
• Communications, Compute, Storage, Security infrastructure including on site data centres and network
• Business systems including SAP Enterprise Asset Management
• Mining and Processing Systems including Automated Haulage and Fleet Management
• Data Management including Data Integration and Data Governance
• Workforce systems including an Integrated Remote Operations Centre
• Achieve a genuine and deep understanding of the customer needs and challenges, and facilitate the design of customised digital solutions
• Identify and document the project scope including In Scope, Out of Scope and battery limits
• Gather, validate and document business requirements and process mapping that obtain business value
• Collaborate with business owner and vendors to align features and requirement, priorities and releases to operations
• Coordinate digital projects through full operational readiness and hand over
• Effectively collaborate with team members, following Agile methodology and actively promoting quality and productivity
• Provide ongoing advice and feedback to the West Musgrave project regarding the implementation of Digital services and equipment

Applicant Requirements

This role requires a self-motivated, hands on and values-based individual with a desire to deliver best practice outcomes with skills, experience, and personal attributes including:
• An experienced digital professional who has successfully delivered as a product owner and business analyst, projects in infrastructure, mining or business systems, and/or data solutions
• Ability to understand a complex greenfields ecosystem, linking multiple capabilities, processes and systems
• Experienced in the delivery of continuous value through Agile frameworks
• Experienced in requirements, selection, product development and hand over to support for major digital projects
• A dynamic operator working across multiple programs and projects
• Strong communication skills across a variety of internal and external stakeholders
• A problem solver who finds innovative solutions to meet the immediate demands without compromising future capability of the project or the site
• Real world knowledge of the mining value chain to collaborate across the project for digital aspirations

To Apply

If the above excites you, and even makes you a little nervous, then we want you to apply! It’s an exciting and transformative time for us and we need creative, collaborative and great people like you.

#comeworkwithus

We are an equal opportunity employer who supports diversity within our workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are encouraged to apply.

Applications close Monday, 2 October 2023.

Shortlisting will commence immediately, apply now!

• Join an iconic Wesfarmers business, leaders in industrial & safety supplies
• Bring your passion & expertise to this role and grow your career with us
• Permanent full-time hybrid role offering work/life balance & fantastic employee benefits

OUR STORY

Blackwoods is Australia’s leading supplier of industrial and safety supplies. For over 140 years, we have supported businesses big and small with our range of over 300,000 products from the world’s best brands. From the Sydney Harbour Bridge to the railway and your local mechanic, we supply what our customers need when they need it, along with unparalleled expertise and service from our passionate team.

With a national footprint of over 50 branches and 6 Distribution Centres, our people are at the heart of everything we do. Being a part of the Wesfarmers group, also means that we have endless opportunities to make a difference, so join us, and let’s help more people build a better Australia.

YOUR OPPORTUNITY

Due to exciting growth in the business, we are looking for an enthusiastic National Sales Analyst to join our sales team based in any capital city (such as Macquarie Park NSW, Carole Park QLD, Regency Park SA and Scoresby VIC) to provide an exceptional level of service that supports our growing customer base.

This role is responsible for ensuring customer data alignment and/or key sales data including incentives and territory mapping is correct. This role will ensure data for all customer territory applications is aligned with Blackwoods systems, reducing errors, and facilitating clean order fulfilment.

Your key responsibilities include, but not limited to:
• Ensure data alignment is maintained to support key sales hierarchy activity and reporting
• Build excel models to support commercial decision making
• Create and maintain robust suites of reporting that illustrate performance across multiple stakeholder groups
• Drive functional Teams (primarily, Sales) understanding in how to utilise data and make commercial decisions
• Engage stakeholders at all levels to ensure process around mapping and alignment can be actioned quickly

To be successful, you will have:
• Ability to plan and schedule priorities, manage strict deadlines, work autonomously and adapt to changing situations
• Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel skills
• Strong written and verbal communication
• Understanding and applying new technologies
• Collaborative approach with the ability to build effective partnerships within own team and across the organisation

CULTURE & BENEFITS

A career with Blackwoods will offer you rewarding experiences and opportunities for growth and development. We have a diverse, inclusive, and safe workplace where our team members care about each other and enjoy building meaningful connections.

To ensure our employees feel valued, supported, and celebrated, we provide a range of employee benefits including:
• Competitive salaries and incentives
• Flexible work arrangements
• A range of diversity and well-being initiatives
• Ability to purchase up to 4 weeks additional annual leave
• Team events, celebrations and development opportunities
• Team member discounts on Wesfarmers products
• Discounted offers from over 300 corporate partners
• Generous Wesfarmers annual share plans
• Attractive parental leave policy and more

NEXT STEPS

If you meet most of the criteria listed above and would like to be considered for this opportunity, please send your application today. We will be contacting suitable candidates as we receive them.

As part of our recruitment process and commitment to safety, you may be required to undertake background checks (which may include a police check, a pre-employment medical assessment; and/or drug & alcohol testing) as part of your application process.

Blackwoods also promotes diversity and inclusion across our workplaces and encourages applications from all backgrounds, including people from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities, the LGBTI+ community and people with disabilities.

Please note: All applications will be reviewed after 3rd October 2023.

The difference you will make at Insignia Financial

Job Description

Job Title: Commercial Analyst - Drakes Supermarkets

Location: Adelaide, SA

Almost 50 years since Roger Drake purchased his first supermarket in 1974, Drakes Supermarkets has now become the largest independent grocery retailer in Australia.

Drakes Supermarkets is a proudly Australian-owned and independent retail chain, committed to providing exceptional service and quality products to our valued customers. With a strong emphasis on community involvement and supporting local suppliers, they have grown to become a trusted name in the retail industry.

The Opportunity

As a Commercial Analyst at Drakes Supermarkets, you will be an integral part of business communicating key data insights around shrinkage, consumer behaviours, sales and profit of the fresh food departments to help the organsiation make data driven decisions that drive the business forward.

Key Responsibilities
• Reporting Development, Modelling, Maintenance, and Enhancement:
• Develop and maintain a comprehensive monthly reporting suite for Fresh Supervisors and Store Managers.
• Understand the specific information needs of the fresh food management team and tailor reports accordingly.
• Assist in the development of annual Fresh Food Department budgets for sales, wages, and gross profit.
• Actively participate in the month-end close process and review Fresh Food Departments' profitability.
• Implement procedures and reporting requirements to improve shrinkage within our fresh areas of operation.
• Create insightful dashboards to monitor the performance of key Fresh initiatives such as 'Bakery Model,' 'The Little Kitchen,' and 'Store Concepts.'
• Ensure transparent, visual and accurate Fresh P&L reporting.
• Commercial Analysis:
• Conduct quarterly analysis and benchmarking of Fresh Food Department
• Provide analysis and support for new Fresh Food opportunities, contributing to robust business cases.
• Collaborate with the Commercial Manager to coordinate and manage quarterly performance reviews with the Fresh Food Manager and Supervisors.
• Analyse monthly performance data for Fresh departments and entities, identifying trends and improvement areas.
• Work closely with Fresh Food Supervisors to identify budget shortfalls and develop action plans for improvement.
• Identify underperforming Fresh Food Departments and devise strategies to enhance their profit performance.
• Ensure optimal inventory levels in Fresh Food Departments, aligning with maximum days sales cover.
• Perform a key Fresh Food operating expenditure analysis, including areas such as wages and freight.
• Continuous Process Improvement:
• Collaborate with Fresh Food Supervisors to implement profit improvement initiatives and track their effectiveness.
• Utilise data to proactively highlight operational performance issues and work with the team to implement improvements.
• Identify opportunities for terms improvement with suppliers, contributing to cost efficiencies.
• Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the Finance Team, ensuring our financial reporting evolves to support Drakes' profitability.
• Initiate initiatives to promote a cohesive one-team culture within the commercial analytics team and the wider Fresh Finance team.

Experience And Skills
• * Proven experience in budget development and analysis.
• Exposure to Data Visual Applications is essential to the success of the role.
• Being able to translate and articulate the data to decision makers is imperative.
• Background in the commercial retail or fast-moving consumer goods industry.
• Demonstrated expertise in modeling and complex data analysis.
• Track record of identifying, planning, and successfully implementing improvements.

Drakes Supermarkets is an equal opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

For more details please contact Thilini Elkaduwa at EGM Partners for a confidential discussion.

Department for Infrastructure and Transport

Job reference: 549233

Location: 5000 - ADELAIDE

Job status: Long Term Contract

Eligibility: Open to Everyone

The Department for Infrastructure and Transport (DIT) has diverse responsibilities for transport systems and services, infrastructure planning and provision within South Australia.

Duties

The Geographical Information Systems (GIS) Analyst provides a range of accurate, well defined and complete geospatial, geographic, cartographic and location data using technologies, 3D mapping, smart devices, and a wide range of online and third party location data sources. The role will undertake data capture, data maintenance, governance and analysis, whilst supporting system and data enhancement to inform planning, engineering and delivery of the Torrens to Darlington (T2D) project for the North-South Corridor Program Delivery Office (NSC).

The GIS Analyst reports to Manager, Digital Engineering and will deliver high quality data analytics relating to a broad range of activities, including all aspects of research, analysis, recommendations, implementation and reporting undertaken across a range of NSC project disciplines. The GIS Analyst will research contemporary and future tools and processes to provide continuous improvement and data analysis.

Requirements

Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline such as geographical/geospatial information science, environmental science, cartography or a related field, or equivalent experience.

The following are technical capabilities required for the role:

Demonstrates advanced understanding of GIS software architecture and data standards encompassing the capacity to build, maintain and manage GIS data, metadata definition to support reporting for the Department. Provide geospatial services including spatial data creation, data management, spatial analysis, map production and analysis in ArcGIS Enterprise Portal;

Experience in using spatial information systems and software for map production, spatial data capture, analysis, reporting and content management (preferably in an infrastructure environment) and in the use of structured query language (SQL);

Demonstrated advanced computing, numeracy, literacy, and data management skills, including Microsoft Excel and Power BI;

Programming knowledge such as Python, SQL would be advantageous for the role; and

Demonstrates ability to act with urgency and efficacy, perform effectively under pressure, advise on broad discipline knowledge, formulate, and suggest practical and innovative solutions and to implement change and mitigate risk.

Special Conditions

The successful candidate will be required to provide a National Police Check prior to employment with the Department. Additional employment checks may be required relevant to the role being undertaken as outlined in the role statement.

Some out of hours and weekend work, along with some intra/interstate travel requiring overnight stays, may be required.

Tenure of Vacancy

Temporary appointment up to 5 years

Remuneration

ASO5 - $84,522 to $94,003 per annum

Enquiries

Mr Gert Van Aswegen

Digital Engineering Manager

Telephone: 0418 742 283

Email: gert.vanaswegen@sa.gov.au

Application Instructions

Applications can be submitted online by clicking the 'Apply now' button.

Additional Notes

Applicants are required to submit a CV and a Cover Letter of no more than 2 pages addressing the selection criteria in the attached Role Statement.

The SA Government is an Equal Opportunity Employer and safety is a core value.

Role Statement - GIS Analyst (ASO5)

Applications close: 27/10/2023 5:00 PM

Flexibility Statement

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

Our client is a global leader in products for the building industries, operating across 16 countries and around 15,000 employees. They have a strong culture of seeking continuous improvement and you will get the opportunity to working alongside a great team and learn and grow your expertise.

In this role you will be required to create and adhere to a call cycle and execute all essential sales activities such as planning, prospecting, development of propositions and face to face selling.

You will provide customers with product knowledge across a range of products and secure new clients and provide accurate quotes. Your activity will be measured on revenue, material margin and other sales measures.

In this role you will be provided with a company vehicle as it is mainly a field based role.

The successful candidate will bring:

• Previous successful sales experience, preferable in the building / construction industry

• Excellent communication and negotiation skills

• Sound understanding of industry channels

• Planning and implementation skills

• Excellent team work skills

• Advanced computer skills - Microsoft Office

Introduction:

Adelaide PHN is seeking an experienced professional with skills in data analytics, and experience in reporting, to join our team as Performance and Reporting Coordinator. This role is pivotal to understanding and sharing the impact of our work with funders and stakeholders, including the community we serve.

About Us

Adelaide Primary Health Network (Adelaide PHN) is an independent, not for profit, primary health care organisation based in Adelaide.

We aim to improve the health and wellbeing of the Adelaide community by coordinating and integrating health and community services and by working in partnership to identify local needs and create strategies in response to keeping people well and out of hospital; improving their experience AND their health outcomes – to deliver on our vision of ‘shaping the health system to deliver better outcomes for vulnerable people, and a healthier Adelaide’.

Why you should come work with us

Adelaide PHN offers a great range of benefits to our employees, including:
• Competitive remuneration and work-life balance.
• Access to generous not for profit Salary Sacrifice taxation benefits including up to $15,900 for living expenses and $2,650 for meal and entertainment.
• Work from home opportunities.
• Leave Loading
• Additional paid leave between Christmas and New Year, in addition to annual leave entitlements.
• Generous allowance toward professional development.
• Family friendly and flexible working arrangements.
• Collaboration with passionate likeminded professionals.
• Free Employment Assistance Program.

Description:

The Role

Reporting to the Planning and Performance Manager, this role will lead the Adelaide PHN 12 month performance report and annual report, and work alongside the organisation and engage key stakeholders to develop, track, analyse and report on population health, service and organisational performance data.

The successful incumbent will provide and maintain accurate reports and reference materials for both internal and external audiences, covering key activities including Adelaide PHN’s process, regulatory and stakeholder reporting and interactions with the Commonwealth Department of Health, as well as identify as well as identify opportunities to streamline and improve internal and external reporting.

For more information, you can view the position description here (Seek, Indeed and LinkedIn applicants please go to our website)

Skills and Experiences:

About You

Using your knowledge gained from a public health, population health, social science, health promotion, planning, evaluation, public/health sector management or similar relevant field, along with at least 5 years experience in a similar data analysis and performance reporting role, the successful incumbent will have demonstrated experienced in advanced computer skills, experience with data systems and reporting tools.

You will have the technical skills to interpret and provide high level analysis, contemporary and robust knowledge of data governance, a commitment to continuous improvement and be a skilled communicator to engage the organisation on key deliverables. An understanding of organisation wide key performance indicators and specifically in the health industry is vital.

In addition to this, to be successful in this role you’ll need:
• To be committed to the development, maintenance and improvement of data collection systems and management
• Be highly organised and able to communicate across the organisation to achieve high quality reporting
• Have the technical skills to interpret data requirements and calculate population health and service data accurately and consistently
• Be flexible and able to manage change and competing demands
• Work collaboratively in a diverse cross- functional work environment
• Be able to convey complex information, simply

How To Apply

To apply please click on Apply - include in your application a maximum 2 page covering letter outlining your suitability for the role against the skills and experience required, together with your resume.

Applications will ONLY be considered when received through our careers portal.

To apply, you must have the legal right to work in Australia.

Applications close 12 noon Monday 9 October 2023. However, shortlisting for this position may commence earlier.

For further information about this role, please contact Donna Shotton, Planning and Performance Manager on 08 8219 5900 or dshotton@adelaidephn.com.au.
